snippet: The process will ultimately help calculate how many people were killed or seriously hurt by the flawed switches.
abstract: Claims are being accepted by fund that General Motors put in place to compensate victims of accidents caused by faulty ignition switches; process will ultimately help to calculate number of people killed or seriously hurt by defect; GM hopes fund will help put crisis, and public relations fallout, behind company.

byline.contributor: Danielle Ivory and Rachel Abrams contributed reporting from New York and Hilary Stout from Jeffersonville, Vt.

lead_paragraph: The process will ultimately help calculate how many people were killed or seriously hurt by the flawed switches.

headline.main: Victims of Defective G.M. Ignition Switches Begin Filing Claims
headline.print_headline: Victims Begin Filing Claims In G.M. Case
